results.title: 100 years of Australian football
results.creator_credit: David Barham, Neil Kearney, Australian Football League, Seven Network Limited (Australia) and Visual Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: For lovers of the great game of Australian Rules Football, this documentary highlights the game’s magnificent 100 year history. Using archival footage and interviews, the legends of the game including the great Jack Dyer and Mr. Football himself, Ted Whitten are featured together with many past and present heroes.

results.title: Peeping Tom
results.creator_credit: Michael Powell and Michael Powell (Theatre) Ltd
results.brief_description: A withdrawn psychopath films young women as he impales them with the camera’s tripod, forcing them to watch their own death throes in a mirror mounted on the camera. Now considered a masterpiece, Michael Powell’s film foreshadowed the slasher genre.

constellations_other.name: Capturing first-person POV
constellations_other.description: A comparison of how videogames and feature films have used first person POV shots and sequences and how (for the latter) camera technology has impacted on this.

results.description: In 1960 “Peeping Tom” took a ferocious drubbing from the English critical establishment. Powell saw it not as a horror film but ‘a film of compassion, of observation and of memory … a film about the cinema from 1900 to 1960 … the opposite to a realistic film … a reverie’. A withdrawn psychopath, traumatised by childhood memories, films young women as he impales them with the camera’s tripod, forcing them to watch their own death throes in a mirror mounted on the camera. This is rendered genuinely disturbing as we are drawn into identification with the protagonist through Carl Boehm’s subtly controlled performance. Littered with internal cross references, this is a reflexively subversive film about the fascination of cinema, a film which seeks to make voyeurs of us all. Cast also includes Moira Shearer, Anna Massey and Maxine Audley.
description_for_label: In 1960 “Peeping Tom” took a ferocious drubbing from the English critical establishment. Powell saw it not as a horror film but ‘a film of compassion, of observation and of memory … a film about the cinema from 1900 to 1960 … the opposite to a realistic film … a reverie’. A withdrawn psychopath, traumatised by childhood memories, films young women as he impales them with the camera’s tripod, forcing them to watch their own death throes in a mirror mounted on the camera. This is rendered genuinely disturbing as we are drawn into identification with the protagonist through Carl Boehm’s subtly controlled performance. Littered with internal cross references, this is a reflexively subversive film about the fascination of cinema, a film which seeks to make voyeurs of us all. Cast also includes Moira Shearer, Anna Massey and Maxine Audley.

results.title: Harold Lloyd's world of comedy
results.creator_credit: Harold Lloyd and Harold Lloyd Corporation
results.brief_description: Presents a compilation of the best short Harold Lloyd sequences. Films excerpted include: ‘Safety last’, ‘Hot water’, ‘Why worry’, ‘Feet first’, ‘Girl shy’, ‘Movie crazy’, ‘Professor beware’.

results.title: Hector's roadshow
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Humour and fantasy are employed to convey an essential road safety message to young children. Kerb drill, bicycle safety and the use of seat belts are emphasized in this zany pantomine. Cast: Tony Strachan and Greg Temple. Cinematographer/Director of Photography: Edwin Scragg.

results.title: Say goodbye
results.creator_credit: David H. Vowel and Wolper Productions
results.brief_description: Examines the careless arrogance by the human population toward the delicate balance of our relationship to the wildlife on earth and challenges us to rethink our role in nature.

results.title: Mining: a career for you
results.brief_description: This film provides a look at the career opportunities offered by the mining industry. It shows the Western Australian School of Mines at Kalgoorlie where the student may study for a career in mining, and also reveals some of the field work he will be required to perform in the industry.

results.title: The Drover's wife: a short story by Henry Lawson
results.creator_credit: Gian Manara, Allan Ashbolt, ABC and Henry Lawson
results.brief_description: A visual interpretation of the short story by Henry Lawson. The drover’s wife remembers incidents and habits of her life as she sits up all night waiting for a snake to come from its hiding place inside her house so she can kill it. Starring Clarissa Kaye, Mark Healey, William McCallum, Vicki Waller. Narrated by Allan Ashbolt.

results.title: Chicago
results.creator_credit: Rob Marshall, Martin Richards and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: A dazzling spectacle that glides between the intrigue of rivalry and betrayal to sensational fantasies of music and dance! At a time when crimes of passion result in celebrity headlines, nightclub sensation Velma Kelley and spotlight-seeking Roxie Hart find themselves sharing space on Chicago’s famed Murderess Row. Velma and Roxie will stop at nothing to outdo each other in their obsessive pursuit of fame and celebrity. Stars Rene Zellweger, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Richard Gere with Queen Latifah, John C. Reilly, Lucy Liu. Dion Beebe is director of photography. Based on the musical play Chicago, directed and choreographed for the stage by Bob Fosse; based on the play by Maurine Dallas Watkins. (Awards: Winner of several awards including Winner of 2003 Academy Awards for Best Motion Picture of the Year; Winner of 2003 BAFTA Film Awards for Best Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role: Catherine Zeta-Jones; Winner of 2003 Golden Globes Awards for Best Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy)

results.title: Monkey trouble
results.creator_credit: Franco Amurri, Mimi Polk and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Dodger, a monkey, belongs to a crooked street performer but escapes, his life to end up in the arms of an innocent little girl. Her mother has no idea that her daughter is harboring a fugitive. Unfortunately, Dodger’s naughty habits get the best of him as his mischief plunges everyone he meets into major monkey trouble. Cast includes Thora Birch, Mimi Rogers, Victor Argo, Christopher McDonald, Harvey Keitel.
